description: Assessment pathway for acute sinusitis symptoms aligned to Pharmacy First England service guidance.
inclusion: Patients aged 12 years and over with acute nasal congestion, discharge, or facial pain.
Symptoms present for 28 days or fewer without signs of severe systemic illness.
Able to use intranasal corticosteroids or delayed oral antibiotics if indicated.
exclusion: Severe systemic upset, meningitis, or intracranial complications.
Known chronic rhinosinusitis requiring ENT follow-up.
safetyNetting: Seek urgent care if swelling around the eye worsens or vision changes occur.
Arrange GP review if symptoms persist beyond 3 weeks despite treatment.
Return for reassessment if fever develops or pain becomes severe.

pass.label: Age within Pharmacy First sinusitis range.

fail.label: Pharmacy First sinusitis service is for age ≥12 years.

result.headline: Refer - patient under 12 years
result.summary: Outside scope of Pharmacy First acute sinusitis pathway.
actions: Arrange GP assessment for under 12s with sinusitis symptoms.

fail.label: Symptoms exceed 28 days - likely chronic rhinosinusitis.

result.headline: Refer - chronic symptom duration
result.summary: Persistent symptoms beyond 4 weeks require GP review.
actions: Arrange GP follow-up for chronic sinus symptoms.

warnings: Recent antibiotics - check resistance risk before supply.
Confirm penicillin allergy status before prescribing.

pass.label: Red flag symptom identified - urgent referral required.

result.headline: Urgent referral - suspected orbital or systemic complication
result.summary: Escalate immediately due to red flag sinusitis features.
actions: Arrange same-day assessment via 999/urgent care as appropriate.

result.headline: Refer - immunocompromise is an exclusion
result.summary: Requires GP review due to higher risk of complications.
actions: Arrange GP follow-up and provide self-care advice pending review.

pass.label: Symptoms prolonged or double sickening - consider delayed antibiotic.

result.headline: Consider delayed antibiotic - prolonged course
result.summary: Discuss issuing a delayed antibiotic if symptoms fail to improve in 48 hours.
actions: Offer a delayed prescription for Doxycycline 100 mg once daily for 7 days if no allergy.
Reinforce nasal saline irrigation and analgesia while monitoring symptoms.
Advise patient to start antibiotic only if symptoms persist or worsen after 48 hours.

trace.label: Criteria met for Pharmacy First supply.

result.headline: Supply mometasone nasal spray for 14 days
result.summary: Patient meets criteria for symptomatic management with intranasal corticosteroid.
actions: Supply Mometasone furoate 50 micrograms nasal spray two sprays per nostril once daily for 14 days.
Advise regular saline irrigation and oral analgesia (paracetamol/ibuprofen if suitable).
Provide written safety-netting covering red flag escalation.

supply.dosage: Two sprays into each nostril once daily for 14 days
supply.notes: Advise gentle nose blowing before use and prime spray prior to first dose.
